data.title: Better than I expected
data.text: I am a vegetarian and didn't expect much from here, but they had the most delicious artichoke sandwich.  The place was nice and peaceful and the staff was friendly.

data.title: Pleasant surprise
data.text: Tasty and varied menu - something for every palate!  Very pleasant and relaxing atmosphere and good service.

data.title: great spot for lunch
data.text: Though the menu is not extensive it is adequate for I think most people to find something for lunch that sounds appetizing.  The food is very good.  Very nicely presented.  Fast and friendly service.  Lovely view of courtyard and museum.  Very reasonable prices.

data.title: Poor service
data.text: During OWE festival decided to lunch here.  Although the food was good our dining  experience was not .  Took a very long time to get our order and we were only one of three tables there at the time.  Asked server for an extra plate which was not received.

data.title: It's not just a place to eat, it's a dining experience
data.text: Once again, the Museum Cafe was outstanding in the quality of food, gluten fee bread, the dish presentation, very clean facility, and friendly helpful wait staff. I ordered the Fenugreek Turkey Sandwich with a side of fresh fruit. Excellent choice!!!  Every time dining there, I have tried something different and have been very happy with the choices.

data.title: Good place to eat especially before concerts and performances
data.text: The food has been good and the portions are very reasonable, they don't gorge you! Recently however there has been a massive change in their menu and modus operandi! Will have to Reserve judgment on that change, it may not be for the best. I usually ate there every time I visited, hope that does not have to change!

data.title: Great food at the cafe!
data.text: The cafe has a wonderful selection of food.  It is reasonable priced with a lovely area to eat.  It will rival any gourmet food at other restaurant.

data.title: Worth a Stop...Just for Lunch
data.text: We were visiting the museum and decided to stop at the cafe for lunch.  Usually museum cafes are boring and the food is dreadful.  Not here.  The menu is very interesting and quite delicious as well.  The art museum is great...but the cafe is worth a stop on its own.

data.title: Asparagus sandwich
data.text: Wonderful and a pleasant surprise. The pesto sauce was great. Bread toasted nicely. A very healthy and refreshing vegetarian option!!

data.title: Great place.
data.text: Unique delicious menu choices. I had a salad that was wonderful. My niece had a Grilled Cheese that I had to help her eat.

data.title: Very enjoyable: tasty food & pleasant atmosphere
data.text: We enjoyed a soup and half sandwich lunch -- freshly prepared and delicious! You order and pay at the counter,  get a number, and it's delivered to your table. We sat in the glass-walled addition with sunshine and view of a little garden area adding to a pleasant meal.

data.title: Lots of choices, great food
data.text: I had BBQ pulled pork sandwich & collard greens - yummy. Lots of selection, lots of seating, a very pleasant place to eat. Looks like staff eats there too.

data.title: Nice stop on way to Symphony
data.text: The Café offers a limited menu but has a nice creative flair. Not much in the way of ambiance but the beverages (wine/beer) are fairly priced as is the food. Get a sandwich or salad for under $10 or splurge on one of the daily specials like Ratatouille En Croute or Escolar ( a fish I never heard of until now) priced from $13 to $17 and served with a small salad. The soups were lobster bisque and Pumpkin Sausage (cup $3 and bowl $5). Both soups were very tasty. Will definitely go back.

data.title: Very slow!
data.text: The food was good although overpriced as we expected.  But the service was extremely slow and the "servers" were unconcerned & not helpful.  The cafe was perhaps half full and the food ordered was cold sandwiches, so really couldn't see why it took over an hour to get our food.  Don't eat here if you have a bus to board at a certain time!

data.title: Destination cafe!
data.text: I would return for the mustard chicken salad anytime I was in the area. There is no reason to leave that worthwhile museum during the whole day. I also enjoyed the tomato-basil soup. The sugar cookies were great too. The prices gives high value for the portion size and high quality. Hubby had the main salad, which I avoided due to the salami, which is usually spicy, processed, and high-fat. A few more menu alternatives that had milder flavors than goat cheese would have given me more choices, but then I might have missed that excellent chicken that I would certainly repeat ,anyway.

data.title: Amazing food!!!
data.text: The food here is amazing!!! Even if you are not an art person, you should definitely go to the museum just for the food. I highly recommend this! Also, the menu changes, so go back more than once!

data.title: Toledo Museum Cafe is pretty good.
data.text: They actually have an on-site cafe in the main building of the museum and there is a cafe in the glass pavilion so I'm not such which is being reviewed here, but I went to both and both are very good. The staff are very friendly and try to get your order together quickly and the place is surrounded by photos, art or glass work so I think it looks great. If you're already at the museum then check them out if you're hungry or need a coffee/tea. Enjoy!

data.title: Great Museum AND Cafe'.  What a great combination
data.text: We wanted to catch an exhibit here but hadn't had lunch so it was an obvious choice but we were amazed that it was one of the best choices we could have made.  If you are looking for the best burger or pizza in town, this isn't it.  But the soups, salads and sandwiches were artfully prepared and delicious.  I checked the button for "Is this one of the best meals you've had?" and I should qualify that with "for the price".  The price was shamefully reasonable.  You order at the register when you enter and get a number and the food is delivered to your table.  But the woman at the register was very patient in explaining the options and even suggesting combinations that were not on the list for the "Half and Half" combos (I.e. combine a half salad, sandwich with a cup of soup at a discounted price).

data.title: Really such
data.text: Really, such a pleasant surprise. You don't expect much when it is a small cafe at a tourist attraction but this place goes out of his way to make sure they serve good food at a reasonable price .. my salad was delicious and very unique buttermilk ranch dressing. My meal was less than $10 gorgeous surroundings and really a very very tasty salad I paid the extra $3 for the chicken and everything was just wonderful really, pleasant surprise. Don't expect much what ... they go out of way to make sure they serve good go for a reasonable price salad was delicious.. and a very  buttermilk ranch dressing. My meal was less than 10 dollars.... Gorgeous surroundings really very very tasty salad I pay the extra 3 dollars for the chicken everything was just wonderful

data.title: Tasty pulled pork sandwich
data.text:
We had a late lunch here last Saturday afternoon after spending a few hours at the Toledo Art Museum. We had to make a long road trip shortly thereafter and didn't want to eat a huge meal, so we decided to split the cafe's pulled pork sandwich special that comes with a side of kettle chips.

You order and pay for your meal at the counter near the entrance to the cafe, whereupon they give you a table number marker and send you off to take the seat of your choice. A server comes along later and delivers the food to your table number. We chose to sit at a clean table with a tablecloth in the upper glass-walled area of the cafe because it was empty at the time.

Our sandwich arrived in less than 10 minutes. The pork was of the BBQ sauce variety and was very tasty -- even split in two the sandwich was big enough to kill our appetite for a few hours. 

Not bad for under $10, including the $1 we left for the server.
